intro: Conopodium silaifolium, commonly known as the silvery-leaved bladder nut, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its fruit is a dry, two-lobed capsule containing several seeds. Conopodium silaifolium is often found in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
